ASHP1.name: Air-source heat pump (Energy Saving Trust 2013 average SPFH4: 2.45)
ASHP1.description: Install a heat pump to provide heat to your home. The air-source heat pump upgrades the temperature of the ambient external air through a condenser unit to upgrade its temperature to be useful in your home. A heat pump is more efficient at low flow temperatures.
ASHP1.key_risks: poor design, installation and controls set-up.
ASHP1.notes: A heat pump requires careful design, installation and comissioning to ensure efficient operation. Works best with lower temperatures for space heating - so with underfloor heating or oversized radiators designed for lower flow and return temperatures.
ASHP1.maintenance: Regular servicing and monitoring to ensure efficient operation.

GSHP1.name: Ground-source heat pump (Energy Saving Trust 2013 average SPFH4: 2.82)
GSHP1.description: Install a heat pump to provide heat to your home. A series of pipes in laid in the ground, or a borehole is dug, so that low-grade heat can be extracted from the ground, which remains at a roughly constant temperature throughout the year, this is then upgraded through a condenser unit to provide higher temperatures. A heat pump is more efficient at low flow temperatures.
GSHP1.key_risks: poor design, installation and controls set-up.
GSHP1.notes: A heat pump requires careful design, installation and comissioning to ensure efficient operation. Works best with lower temperatures for space heating - so with underfloor heating or oversized radiators designed for lower flow and return temperatures.
GSHP1.maintenance: Regular servicing and monitoring to ensure efficient operation.

GSHP2.name: Ground-source heat pump (Energy Saving Trust 2013 high performance SPFH4: 3.40)
GSHP2.description: Install a heat pump to provide heat to your home. A series of pipes in laid in the ground, or a borehole is dug, so that low-grade heat can be extracted from the ground, which remains at a roughly constant temperature throughout the year, this is then upgraded through a condenser unit to provide higher temperatures. A heat pump is more efficient at low flow temperatures.
GSHP2.key_risks: poor design, installation and controls set-up.
GSHP2.notes: A heat pump requires careful design, installation and comissioning to ensure efficient operation. Works best with lower temperatures for space heating - so with underfloor heating or oversized radiators designed for lower flow and return temperatures.
GSHP2.maintenance: Regular servicing and monitoring to ensure efficient operation.
